Core¶

class dmipy_jax.core.modeling_framework.JaxMultiCompartmentModel(models)[source]¶

Bases: object

A class for combining multiple signal models into a Multi-Compartment Model (MCM).

This class wraps the compose_models functional composition with an object-oriented interface compatible with the OptimistixFitter and user-friendly parameter management (dictionaries).

fit(acquisition, data, method='Levenberg-Marquardt', compute_uncertainty=True)[source]¶

Fits the model to data.

Parameters:

  • acquisition – JaxAcquisition object

  • data – Signal data array. Shape (N_meas,) for single voxel or (N_vox, N_meas) for multiple.

  • method – Optimization method (default: “Levenberg-Marquardt”).

  • compute_uncertainty – If True, computes CRLB standard deviations (default: True).

Returns:

Fitted parameters in dictionary format.

If compute_uncertainty is True, includes keys with ‘_std’ suffix.

Return type:

dict

parameter_array_to_dictionary(parameter_array)[source]¶

Converts the flat result array back to a user-friendly dictionary.

parameter_dictionary_to_array(parameter_dictionary)[source]¶

Converts a dictionary of parameters to the flat array expected by the kernel.

dmipy_jax.core.particle_engine.brownian_step(key: Array, positions: Array, shift_fn: Callable, diffusion_coeff: float | Array, dt: float, kT: float = 1.0) → Array[source]¶

Computes one step of Brownian motion with potentially anisotropic diffusion.

Adapted from jax_md.simulate.brownian but supports Tensor diffusion coefficients.

Parameters:

  • key – PRNGKey for noise generation.

  • positions – (N, dim) array of particle positions.

  • shift_fn – Function to apply boundary conditions.

  • diffusion_coeff –

    • Scalar: Isotropic, homogenous diffusion.

    • (3,) Vector: Anisotropic diagonal diffusion (axis-aligned).

    • (N, 3, 3) Tensor: Fully anisotropic diffusion per particle. (Note: Spatially varying maps would need a lookup mechanism,

      here we assume D is provided per-particle or globally).

  • dt – Time step.

  • kT – Temperature (default 1.0).

Returns:

New positions (N, dim).

dmipy_jax.core.particle_engine.check_gpu_visibility()[source]¶

Checks if JAX can see the GPU and prints the status.

Returns:

True if GPU is available, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

dmipy_jax.core.particle_engine.create_neighbor_list(displacement_fn: Callable, box_size: float | Array, r_cutoff: float, capacity_multiplier: float = 1.25, disable_cell_list: bool = False) → NeighborList[source]¶

Creates a basic neighbor list for collision/barrier detection.

Parameters:

  • displacement_fn – Function to compute displacement (metric).

  • box_size – The size of the simulation box.

  • r_cutoff – Cutoff distance for neighbors.

  • capacity_multiplier – Multiplier for initial capacity estimation.

  • disable_cell_list – If True, uses O(N^2) global search (good for small N).

Returns:

An init_fn, apply_fn tuple (or NeighborList object in newer jax-md). You typically call .allocate(positions) on this.

dmipy_jax.core.particle_engine.non_periodic_box() → Tuple[Callable, Callable][source]¶

Defines a non-periodic (infinite) box for whole-brain tracking.

Returns:

(displacement_fn, shift_fn) pair compatible with jax-md.

dmipy_jax.core.particle_engine.periodic_box(box_size: float) → Tuple[Callable, Callable][source]¶

Defines a periodic box for tissue simulations.

Parameters:

box_size – The side length of the cubic box.

Returns:

(displacement_fn, shift_fn) pair compatible with jax-md.

class dmipy_jax.core.solvers.BlochSimulator(t1: float, t2: float, m0: Array | None = None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Simulates the Bloch equations for Nuclear Magnetic Resonance.

dM/dt = M x gamma B - R(M - M0)

where: M is the magnetization vector [Mx, My, Mz] B is the magnetic field vector [Bx, By, Bz] gamma is the gyromagnetic ratio R is the relaxation matrix (diagonal with 1/T2, 1/T2, 1/T1) M0 is the equilibrium magnetization

vector_field(t, m, args)[source]¶

Rate of change dM/dt.

Parameters:

  • t – Time

  • m – Magnetization vector M(t)

  • args – Tuple containing (gradient_func, position) gradient_func: G(t) -> array (3,) [T/m] or similar scaling position: r -> array (3,) [m]

dmipy_jax.core.solvers.solve_diffusion_sde(t_span: Tuple[float, float], y0: Array, drift: Callable[[float, Array, Any], Array], diffusion: Callable[[float, Array, Any], Array], dt0: float = 0.001, key: PRNGKey | None = None, args: Any = None, save_at: SaveAt | None = None)[source]¶

Solve a Stochastic Differential Equation for diffusion.

dY = drift(t, Y) dt + diffusion(t, Y) dW

Parameters:

  • t_span – (t_start, t_end)

  • y0 – Initial state (e.g. positions of particles), shape (N, D).

  • drift – Function f(t, y, args) -> (N, D)

  • diffusion – Function g(t, y, args) -> (N, D, BrownianDim) or (N, D) representing scale of noise.

  • dt0 – Step size.

  • key – JAX PRNG Key for noise.

  • args – Extra arguments for drift/diffusion functions.

  • save_at – Checkpoints.

Returns:

diffrax solution.
